rea.rules.logic_manipulator.delete_redundant_terms module

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.delete_redundant_terms.remove_redundant_terms(terms: Set[rea.rules.term.Term]) → Set[rea.rules.term.Term][source]

Remove redundant terms from a clause, returning only the necessary terms

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.helpers module

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.helpers.terms_set_to_neuron_dict(terms: Set[rea.rules.term.Term])[source]

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.merge module

Merge multiple rules of into Disjunctive Normal Form rules

e.g. if x>1 AND y<3 AND z<1 THEN 1 if x>4 THEN 2 if y<0.4 THEN 2 -> if (x>1 AND y<3 AND z<1) THEN 1 if (x>4) OR (y<0.4) THEN 2

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.merge.merge(rules: Set[rea.rules.rule.Rule])[source]

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.satisfiability module

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.satisfiability.is_satisfiable(clause: rea.rules.clause.ConjunctiveClause)[source]
Return whether or not the clause is satisfiable. Unsatisfiable if empty

or a neurons min value >= its max value

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.satisfiability.remove_unsatisfiable_clauses(clauses: Set[rea.rules.clause.ConjunctiveClause])[source]

Remove unsatisfiable clauses

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.substitute_rules module

rea.rules.logic_manipulator.substitute_rules.substitute(total_rule: rea.rules.rule.Rule, intermediate_rules: rea.rules.ruleset.Ruleset) → rea.rules.rule.Rule[source]
Substitute the intermediate rules from the previous

layer into the total rule
